title: Poster, "Noblet Serigraphie", 1995
signed: In pencil, lower right: Seymour Chwast
inscribed: In pencil, lower left: 32/100.  In image, imprinted at top, from upper left to upper center: NOBLET SERIGRAPHIE; at right, as vertical stenciled letters, COLOR
dimensions: Image, 73.7 x 43.2 cm (29 x 17 in. ); sheet, 88.9 x 55. 9cm (35 x 22 in.)
creditline: Gift of Karen McCready and Jean-Yves Noblet
description: Large hand squeezes a tube of printing ink that ejects blue, yellow, green, and pink pigment.  This print serves as a poster  promoting the New York City screenprinting workshop/studio of Jean-Yves Noblet.  Noblet is noted for his top quality screen printing technique.  He has been the printer for fine print editions by such leading artists as Roy Lichtenstein, Lorna Simpson, and others.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Noblet Serigraphie", 1995. Screenprint. Gift of Karen McCready and Jean-Yves Noblet. 1996-76-1.
